Atemp.help: Known as 'Atemp' in Swedish. Specified in square meters, used for calculating the energy demand

FractionCommercial.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying how large a share of the area which should be treated as commercial buildings, as opposed to residential. Used for calculating the pattern and quantity of energy demand

FractionSchool.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying how large a share of the area which should be treated as school buildings, as opposed to residential. Used for calculating the pattern and quantity of energy demand

FractionOffice.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying how large a share of the area which should be treated as office buildings, as opposed to residential. Used for calculating the pattern and quantity of energy demand

PVArea.help: Specified in square meters, indicating the total areal of solar panels that this agent has at its disposal

HeatPumpMaxInput.help: Heat pumps allow the block agent to convert electricity into heating. This number indicates the maximum total power input, summed over all heat pumps at the agent's disposal

HeatPumpMaxOutput.help: Heat pumps allow the block agent to convert electricity into heating. This number indicates the maximum total power output, summed over all heat pumps at the agent's disposal

BoosterPumpMaxInput.help: Booster pumps allow the block agent to create high-temperature heating, which is needed to cover hot water demand, in scenarios where the local distribution network operates at a low temperature. This number indicates the maximum total power input, summed over all booster heat pumps at the agent's disposal. Will be unused in scenarios without a LEC.

BoosterPumpMaxOutput.help: Booster pumps allow the block agent to create high-temperature heating, which is needed to cover hot water demand, in scenarios where the local distribution network operates at a low temperature. This number indicates the maximum total power output, summed over all booster heat pumps at the agent's disposal. Will be unused in scenarios without a LEC.

HeatPumpForCooling.help: Does the heat pump produce excess cooling? If true, 'free cooling' will also be used, except during summer.

BatteryCapacity.help: A number specifying the battery storage capacity, in kWh

AccumulatorTankCapacity.help: A number specifying the capacity of the agent's accumulator tank (slingtank), in kilowatt-hours. Assuming a temperature of 65 degrees C, 1 cubic metre corresponds to roughly 75 kWh.

FractionUsedForBITES.display: Fraction used for building inertia thermal energy storage
FractionUsedForBITES.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying how much of the block's heated area to use for building inertia thermal energy storage (BITES).

Resource.help: The resource which this agent trades

TransferRate.help: A number specifying (in kWh) the maximum amount of energy the agent can transfer into, or out from, the microgrid in an hour

Atemp.help: Known as 'Atemp' in Swedish. Specified in square meters, used for calculating the energy demand

PVArea.help: Specified in square meters, indicating the total areal of solar panels that this agent has at its disposal

PVEfficiency.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying the efficiency of solar panels that the agent may have at its disposal. If missing, will default to the default PV efficiency specified in 'AreaInfo'

SellExcessHeat.help: Does the grocery store sell any excess low tempered heat from its cooling machines?

HeatPumpMaxInput.help: Heat pumps allow the block agent to convert electricity into heating. This number indicates the maximum total power input, summed over all heat pumps at the agent's disposal

HeatPumpMaxOutput.help: Heat pumps allow the block agent to convert electricity into heating. This number indicates the maximum total power output, summed over all heat pumps at the agent's disposal

BoosterPumpMaxInput.help: Booster pumps allow the block agent to create high-temperature heating, which is needed to cover hot water demand, in scenarios where the local distribution network operates at a low temperature. This number indicates the maximum total power input, summed over all booster heat pumps at the agent's disposal. Will be unused in scenarios without a LEC.

BoosterPumpMaxOutput.help: Booster pumps allow the block agent to create high-temperature heating, which is needed to cover hot water demand, in scenarios where the local distribution network operates at a low temperature. This number indicates the maximum total power output, summed over all booster heat pumps at the agent's disposal. Will be unused in scenarios without a LEC.

AccumulatorTankCapacity.help: A number specifying the capacity of the agent's accumulator tank (slingtank), in kilowatt-hours. Assuming a temperature of 65 degrees C, 1 cubic metre corresponds to roughly 75 kWh.

FractionUsedForBITES.display: Fraction used for building inertia thermal energy storage
FractionUsedForBITES.help: A number from 0 to 1, specifying how much of the block's heated area to use for building inertia thermal energy storage (BITES).

Profile.help: The profile of the heat producer. Determines what type (low/high-temp) of heating which is produced, and when it is produced (time of day, weekdays, seasonal effects etc)

Scale.help: Determines the scale of the heat produced by the agent. For a bakery profile, a scale of 1.0 means an output of 300 kW, 2.0 means 600 kW, etc. For a grocery store profile, scale 1.0 means an average output of 80 kW during daytime May-September.
